name: Phulka
history: Phulka, also known as Roti or Chapati, is a traditional Indian flatbread, widely consumed across the Indian subcontinent. It is a staple in Indian meals and is known for its simple ingredients and cooking method.
description: Phulka is a thin, unleavened flatbread made from whole wheat flour. It is cooked partially on a flat skillet and then directly on an open flame, causing it to puff up. This bread is soft, light, and healthy, typically served with curries or vegetables.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: In a bowl, mix whole wheat flour with a pinch of salt (optional). Gradually add water and knead into a soft, pliable dough. Let it rest for a few minutes.

instructions.title: Roll and Cook the Phulkas
instructions.description: Divide the dough into small balls. Roll each ball into a thin, round shape. Cook on a hot griddle until small bubbles form, then place directly on an open flame until it puffs up and develops brown spots.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the hot Phulkas with a curry, dal, or any other side dish.

tips: The dough should be soft and non-sticky for easy rolling.
Cooking on an open flame should be quick to avoid burning.
variations: Add herbs or spices like cumin to the dough for extra flavor.
Use multigrain flour for a healthier variant.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh but can be stored in an airtight container for up to 24 hours.
storage.instructions: Reheat on a griddle before serving if stored.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a hot griddle or tawa until warm and soft.
presentationTips: Serve in a basket lined with a cloth to keep them warm.
Pair with a variety of chutneys and side dishes for a complete meal.
